title: Jumbled sentence on front page (Canvas / SVG blurb)
body:
I'd gladly work up a PR, but can't figure out what this is trying to say: 

> With d3fc continues this pattern throughout our components, all of the d3fc-series components support both Canvas and SVG rendering.

This is on the front page, in the Canvas / SVG paragraph.

Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work? There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html) and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. [Let them know](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new). Good luck with your project :sparkles: You rock! :palm_tree: --- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/75lb/command-line-args/releases/tag/v4.0.0)

Breaking changes since v3.0.5

  • Removed support for node versions less than v4.0.0

  • The method signature changed. If you're passing a custom argv you now do it this way:

    const argv = [ '--log-level', 'info' ]
commandLineArgs(optionDefinitions, { argv })

    Previously, it was done this way:

    const argv = [ '--log-level', 'info' ]
commandLineArgs(optionDefinitions, argv)

  • String is the new default type function.

New feature

  • Partial parsing - support for unknown options. See the docs and issue 25 for background.

Other changes

  • Fixed #24, #39
  • Overhauled the examples
  • Refactored internals

title: Ask SL blog authors to link to the d3fc components their posts evolved into
body: There are a number of SL blog posts which cover d3 techniques which ultimately made their way into d3fc. As these are now popular reference articles, we should approach the original author and ask if they'd be willing to add reference to their posts linking to the d3fc components their techniques evolved into.

title: Find a way to integrate label layout with zoom
body:
As spotted on StackOverflow, the layout can take a few hundred milliseconds. If this is combined with zoom, the animation becomes very jumpy.

Here's the original question:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41071649/d3-label-layout-on-scatterplots

And a fiddle to illustrate:

https://jsfiddle.net/f5oxcyg7/1/

We probably need some method of rendering a layout without recomputing while a zoom (or brush) is in progress.

title: Throw an error if there are unexpected children of d3fc-svg/d3fc-canvas
body:
I've just debugged a weird problem in safari which came down to the following DOM structure -

```html
<d3fc-svg>
  <svg>...</svg>
  <svg class="something">...</svg>
</d3fc-svg>
```

This is not an supported usage of the element.  There are two workarounds -

* Move the `svg.something` inside the `svg` (useful if it relates to the content of the existing `d3fc-svg`)
* Move the `svg.something` to it's own `d3fc-svg` (useful if you want to use css layout)

We should throw an error if we detect more than one child node inside the `d3fc-svg`/`d3fc-canvas` elements.

Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update. Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right? Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work? There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html) and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. [Let them know](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new). Good luck with your project :sparkles: You rock! :palm_tree: --- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/semantic-release/semantic-release/releases/tag/v6.3.2)

6.3.2 (2016-11-17)

Bug Fixes

  • use travis-deploy-once to reenable travis-pro support (2be6e5d3)

We always want semantic-release to be simple and clean.

On versions 4 and below it requires a Python script, configured with 3 additional lines in your .travis.yml file, to get semantic-release to properly work with test matrices (i.e. testing multiple node versions).

In an attempt to fix this we published version 6 and on with a bundled JavaScript version of that script, so there was no need for additional config anymore.
Unfortunately though this broke compatibility with Travis Pro, because the JavaScript version does not support that. Version 6 never reached the "latest" dist-tag and stayed on "next" for quite some time, just because of this.

This has been the sad state of semantic-release for way too long, so we built travis-deploy-once. Another very simple JavaScript version of that script, but with out-of-the-box Travis Pro support.

So here it is: semantic-release 6.3.2. No more python script awkwardness in your .travis.yml files, no more latest/next confusion.

The last version on "latest" was 4.3.5 so here are the breaking changes that happened since then. Upgrading should be trivial.

From 6.0.0: Breaking Changes

  • If you run travis_after_all and travis-after-all at the same time they'll keep waiting for each other until forever. You have to apply this patch to your .travis.yml.
---
 .travis.yml | 3 ---
 1 file changed, 3 deletions(-)

diff --git a/.travis.yml b/.travis.yml
index a5fbddb..c76091b 100644
--- a/.travis.yml
+++ b/.travis.yml
@@ -14,9 +14,6 @@ before_install:
 - npm i -g npm@^2.0.0
 before_script:
 - npm prune
-- curl -Lo travis_after_all.py https://git.io/vLSON
 after_success:
-- python travis_after_all.py
-- export $(cat .to_export_back)
 - npm run semantic-release
--

(ef162321)

From 5.0.0: Breaking Changes

  • In cases where you pushed a new commit with a "dist-tag" configuration of "next" and no version was previously published as "next", semantic-release failed and did not publish a new version. It will now automatically fall back to the "latest" version to determine a new "next" version.

(7a4c89f1)

title: Update semantic-release to version 6.3.2 🚀
body:
Hello lovely humans, [semantic-release](https://www.npmjs.com/package/semantic-release) just published its new version 6.3.2.
State Update :rocket:
Dependency semantic-release
New version 6.3.2
Type devDependency

There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though. Given that you have a decent test suite, a passing build is a strong indicator that you can take advantage of these changes by merging the proposed change into your project. Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update. Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right? [Let them know](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new). Good luck with your project :sparkles: You rock! :palm_tree: --- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/semantic-release/semantic-release/releases/tag/v6.3.2)

6.3.2 (2016-11-17)

Bug Fixes

  • use travis-deploy-once to reenable travis-pro support (2be6e5d3)

We always want semantic-release to be simple and clean.

On versions 4 and below it requires a Python script, configured with 3 additional lines in your .travis.yml file, to get semantic-release to properly work with test matrices (i.e. testing multiple node versions).

In an attempt to fix this we published version 6 and on with a bundled JavaScript version of that script, so there was no need for additional config anymore.
Unfortunately though this broke compatibility with Travis Pro, because the JavaScript version does not support that. Version 6 never reached the "latest" dist-tag and stayed on "next" for quite some time, just because of this.

This has been the sad state of semantic-release for way too long, so we built travis-deploy-once. Another very simple JavaScript version of that script, but with out-of-the-box Travis Pro support.

So here it is: semantic-release 6.3.2. No more python script awkwardness in your .travis.yml files, no more latest/next confusion.

The last version on "latest" was 4.3.5 so here are the breaking changes that happened since then. Upgrading should be trivial.

From 6.0.0: Breaking Changes

  • If you run travis_after_all and travis-after-all at the same time they'll keep waiting for each other until forever. You have to apply this patch to your .travis.yml.
---
 .travis.yml | 3 ---
 1 file changed, 3 deletions(-)

diff --git a/.travis.yml b/.travis.yml
index a5fbddb..c76091b 100644
--- a/.travis.yml
+++ b/.travis.yml
@@ -14,9 +14,6 @@ before_install:
 - npm i -g npm@^2.0.0
 before_script:
 - npm prune
-- curl -Lo travis_after_all.py https://git.io/vLSON
 after_success:
-- python travis_after_all.py
-- export $(cat .to_export_back)
 - npm run semantic-release
--

(ef162321)

From 5.0.0: Breaking Changes

  • In cases where you pushed a new commit with a "dist-tag" configuration of "next" and no version was previously published as "next", semantic-release failed and did not publish a new version. It will now automatically fall back to the "latest" version to determine a new "next" version.

(7a4c89f1)

title: If you repeatedly invoke data-join with an interval < transition duration, weird things happen
body:
See this example, where the interval timer is 1100ms and the transition duration is 1000ms:

https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-axis/pull/11/files#diff-4163d120e6747b848e4f358d08d85003R32

If you change the interval timer to 1000ms the ticks start to disappear. They all eventually get 'stuck' in a state where their opacity is set to zero.

title: Update ESLint configuration
body: Should we prevent redefinition of variables? see: https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-series/pull/33/files#r88192484

title: Consider adding babel-polfill
body:
As per comment here: https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-annotation/pull/19#discussion_r88014565

It's required by d3fc projects that take screenshots via webshot.

title: Support configurable axis baselines
body: The previous version supported axis baselines, via axis series. This was consciously removed in order to keep this implementation simple - however, I'd like to re-visit this functionality to see whether it could be added in to this re-write. One of our website examples depended on it!

title: grouped series assumes that the first datapoint contains a complete set of 'x' values
body:
https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-series/blob/master/src/groupedBase.js#L20

The works fine if the data has been generated by a d3 DSV parser, but we cannot guarantee that this will always be the case.

title: Allow configuration of bar series offset
body:
The current bar series (and all other series with some notion of width) is implemented to render around the centre point of each location across the cross-axis. In other words, values on the cross-axis represent the centres of each bar.

This works well for rendering bar series where the cross axis is continuous (e.g. linear or time), however the [d3 ordinal scale](https://github.com/d3/d3-scale#ordinal-scales) are more suited to series where the cross axis values represent the start of each bar.

As a result the bar series do not play well with d3 band scales.

In order to solve this, the code which determines the alignment of the underlying d3fc-shape should be configurable:

https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-series/blob/master/src/svg/bar.js#L41

title: Support order?
body: Available in stack and could be useful - https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#stack_order

title: Adopt the same key/keys behavior as d3.stack
body: Explicit exclude/implicit include versus explicit include/implicit exclude. See https://github.com/d3/d3-shape/blob/master/README.md#stack_keys

title: Extend svg/canvas elements rather than wrap them
body:
On the surface this seems like a nicer approach however, there are some issues to work through -
- [ ] Neither of the polyfills support extending SVG elements (https://github.com/WebReflection/document-register-element/issues/24, https://github.com/webcomponents/webcomponentsjs/issues/524)
- [ ] Enabling SVG overflow (even with the `width` style property set to `auto`) seems to cause `clientWidth` to return the overflowed width. This prevents resizing to smaller widths.

title: Check files check passes if files are missing
body: https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-scripts/blob/master/scripts/test.js#L47

title: Allow transitions to be disabled
body: https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-data-join/pull/24

title: Should we be merging enter and update
body:
See: https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-data-join/blob/master/src/dataJoin.js#L40

This makes migration of old d3fc components easier, but is it the correct thing to do? It threw me a little when updating d3fc-axis because my mind was thinking along the lines of D3v4 data joins, where the two are not merged automatically.

title: Allow auto-resize on surfaces
body:
Possible enhancement to allow `auto-resize` to be applied to `d3fc-svg` & `d3fc-canvas`. 

Workaround is to wrap the element in a `d3fc-group`.

title: The 'ticks' component does not reflect the behaviour of d3-axis
body:
The ticks property has some slightly funky behaviour:

> Sets the arguments that will be passed to scale.ticks and scale.tickFormat when the axis is rendered, and returns the axis generator.

https://github.com/d3/d3-axis#axis_ticks

Which you can see being replicated in d3fc:

https://github.com/ScottLogic/d3fc/blob/master/src/scale/ticks.js#L25

However, the d3fc-annotation ticks component des not perform this 'argument capturing' logic.

title: Remove 'flexbox' attributes
body: For d3fcv4 we will not be using flexbox, so no need to add `layout-width` / `layout-height` attributes

title: Investigate using object tag for resize notifications
body:
Possible enhancement to allow all element resize events to be tracked. This [post](http://www.backalleycoder.com/2013/03/18/cross-browser-event-based-element-resize-detection/) explains the technique.

Current workaround is to manually invoke `requestRedraw` when a resize triggering action occurs.

title: The screenshot margins are a little out
body: see: https://github.com/d3fc/d3fc-series/blob/master/screenshots/errorbar.png

title: Canvas equivalents?
body: Currently all components are implemented as SVG only components.

title: Multiple axis example
body:
I'm trying to create D3.js chart with right Y axis (http://bl.ocks.org/d3noob/e34791a32a54e015f57d) and get stuck.

`cartesian` is very convenient for creating standard chart with X and Y axis, but it does not seems to support adding the right Y axis. Is there any way I can decorate `cartesian` to add right Y axis, or do I need to recreate functionalities of `cartesian` myself in order to have right Y axis?

title: Boxplot has z-index issues when rendering to canvas
body: The image above shows the same series rendered with SVG (left) and canvas (right). The mean line is missing from the canvas rendering.

title: Unexpected behaviour if you don't provide a seed value
body:
```
fc.randomGeometricBrownianMotion()()
```

Gives

```
[undefined, NaN, NaN, ...]
```

I think it would be friendlier if, in the absence of a seed value, we defaulted to zero.

On that note, why isn't the seed a component property?

title: extentTime not extentDate
body: To match d3's scaleTime rather than scaleDate

title: Annealing doesn't seem to give stable results
body: Not sure if it's inherently unstable or if it's caused by a random initialisation, if so is there a reasonable, deterministic initial placement algorithm we could use?

title: Very slow demo
body: I think it's because of the overlap calculation, maybe using d3-quadtree would speed it up?

title: Blog post on discontinuous date axis in d3
body: There are a number of issues relating to discontinuous scales. I think a number of them could be closed by a blog post (#826, #824, #750).

title: Ideas for chart examples/tests of d3fc flexibility
body: An issue to bring together any ideas for charts.

title: Work out path to integrating with stochastic package
body: https://github.com/NathanEpstein/stochastic

title: Automate gh-pages deployment
body: Currently this is manually triggered via `npm run site-deploy`

title: donuts and gauge components would be a nice addition
It is difficult to get the width of the bars in various series
body:
[ohlcBase](https://github.com/ScottLogic/d3fc/blob/f752ac1cd19cae25566db4297ae7d5fec8150f53/src/series/ohlcBase.js#L21-L23) has a method for getting the width of the bars.

Could be useful to be able to get the bar width in:
- bar series
- errorBar
- boxPlot
- macd
- elder ray

It also looks like you can't change the bar width on:
- grouped bar series
- macd
- elder ray

title: New Indicator suggestion - Average True Range
body: I recently created it on my project, can do a PR if you are interested.

title: Having a discontinuity that skips weekends + public holidays would be useful
Candlesticks between ticks
body: With intraday candlestick charts it's typical to render candlesticks in between ticks and not on the ticks.  As far as I can see d3fc always renders the candles on axis ticks.  Can the rendering be offset somehow (either ticks or the candles)?

title: Difficult to access extent of indicator renderers in a way consistent with the series components
body:
Currently the series components expose the `yValue` property, which can be used as an extentAccessor, however the indicator renderers only expose a `root` property, which can not be used in such extent calculations. This makes it surprisingly difficult to calculate the extent of the data on a chart with indicator overlays on. See https://github.com/ScottLogic/d3fc-showcase/pull/454 for how I have attempted to get around this currently- as you can see, adding the extentAccessors manually is not an ideal solution for what I imagine is fairly common desired behaviour.

Could the indicator renderers show these properties so that they can be used in extent calculations? Or could there be a natural modification to `fc.util.extent()` such that a call such as
 `fc.util.extent()
.fields('macd')(data);`
would return what would currently have to be calculated by a much more hard-wired call.
`fc.util.extent()
.fields(['macd', 'signal', 'divergence'])(data.macd);`

title: Investigate line simplification lib
body: http://www.toffeemilkshake.co.uk/simplify-line/

title: Unexpected tick spacing when using discontinuity provider
body:
> I created a discontinuityProvider for the foreign exchange market (5 pm Sunday to around 4pm Friday (I just locked it to 4pm to simplify it)). The issue is that the tick spacing becomes unequal when it is applied, even though the chart's data gaps are filled. I looked some at fc.scale.dateTime.tickTransformer, but am not sure where the tick spacing is defined. 
> 
> I assume that there is a date distance metric used for tick spacing, and by closing the gaps I've removed some dates, the result being that the tick that would be placed correctly with gaps is now placed incorrectly.
> 
> Here is an image displaying the problem. The ticks 12pm on Friday and 5pm on Sunday are closer than others (The weekend gap from Friday 4 pm to Sunday 4 pm are removed).  Have you encountered this issue with other discontinuityProviders and do you know of a fix?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/433457/11014997/6ee278e4-8544-11e5-82bf-4cf4126f43d4.png)

title: Assistance for drawing trendlines
body:
It would be good to have a tool that could assist with drawing trend lines. Something similar to that:

http://bl.ocks.org/andredumas/69f49097e9bb5c0c6e4d

title: Support variable column widths with the bar series
body:
Much like #701, I believe we should support histograms too.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Histogram

title: Enable animated rendering of the series
body:
It is very easy to get an animated rendering of a time series and it looks really impressive. An example of what I mean can be found in the primefaces showcase:

http://www.primefaces.org/showcase/ui/chart/animate.xhtml

All that is needed on the implementation side is something that masks already rendered graph, giving the effect of animation.

title: Provide a TypeScript type definition file
body: Not sure how easy to produce but would be nice to have a TypeScript type definition file

title: Add a horizon chart
body: See: https://public.tableau.com/s/gallery/unemployment-horizon-chart

title: Add responsive functionality
body: In d3fc-core (as per #572) I'd really like to see some functionality regarding responsive behaviour

title: Add a pathGenerator.single/pathGenerator.one/pathGenerator.once method
body:
To simplify the pattern we currently have -

```
.attr('d', function(d) { return pathGenerator([d]); });
```

title: Support center alignment of axis ticks
body:
See this example:

![](http://i.stack.imgur.com/WcmRI.png)

Form the following SO question:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17544546/d3-js-align-text-labels-between-ticks-on-the-axis

I originally thought that this could be achieved via decoration, however, having tried, it involves too many calculations that are dependant on scale / ticks etc ...

I think our axes should support tick placement to provide this functionality.

title: Support 'smarter' axis labelling
body:
We should consider supporting axis label wrapping:

http://bl.ocks.org/mbostock/7555321

And calculations of the widest axis label

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17109549/set-y-axis-of-d3-chart-to-fit-widest-label

title: IDEA: Parallel coordinates plot
body:
Might be interesting to create one of these plots to see whether any other 'component' ideas fall out:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parallel_coordinates

title: Intraday discontinuity provider
body: We currently have a discontinuity provider that skips weekends, for intraday charting we could do with one that excludes non trading hours as well as skipping weekends.
